result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail no less than $10,000.

11:42 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula not in court. Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF85, 21CF246, 21CF310, 21TR1436, 1437, 22CF17, 22CF80, 22CF169, and 22CF228. Court notes that there was a request to withdraw. Attorney Cockerham has no information on defendant's nonappearance. Upon defendants failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond.  Asks for no less than $10,000 cash bail per file when apprehended. Court grants warrants, WI and MN, and forfeiture of any bond previously ordered. 22CF169 was set for jury pretrial. State asks that the trial be taken off the calendar. All cash is forfeited. 22CF169, bail no less than $10,000. Cash bail in no less than $10,000 in each of the felony files.
Attorney Cockerham's request to withdraw is granted. 
Defendant is found in default on citations Standard fines in 22TR1436 and 22TR1437. 60 days to pay.
Order to Withdraw
Motion to Withdraw
Affidavit of Mailing

10:46 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court, in custody.  Attorney Lucas Wyshnytsky for Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF169 - Attorney Wyshnytsky received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Asks for trial to be set for OWI -1st. Court sets jury trial and pretrial with statuses on other cases.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:42 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty .   Asks for 6 week continuance.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Andrew Francis Pribula.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes new charges creating issues in making an offer. State has lab results and could be set for trial. Attorney Cockerham in agreement for one more status. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham appeared by video for Andrew Francis Pribula. Court calls case. Attorney Cockerham indicates filed a letter citing authority for what his client is requesting. Defendant would like an appearance bond for the real estate that he owns as a surety. Title report was done and filed with the court. no encumbrances on property. Mortgage prepared with Clerk of Court as mortgagee. 
State indicates fairly unprecedented locally. Doesn't have a position on this motion. 
Court reviewed statutes and case law. Concerned about what happens if he fails to comply. In the past, it was extremely problematic to enforce the bond. Court questions Cockerham on remedies. Cockerham indicates cash bond still ordered and if he violates it is forfeited, he would then be required to post the 4,000. In the absence of him not being able to post that the real estate would be the collateral. The court could then foreclose on the mortgage through corporation counsel and recoup their costs of foreclosure. State check with corporation counsel and they indicated the would not undertake such an action. 
Court denies request. Too difficult a process to undertake. Court not interested in becoming holder of liens.

Att Cockerham- received information, not guilty pleas. Requests status
Court sets date
  Status conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

01:27 PM Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in court with attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky.  Defendant Andrew Francis Pribula in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's address updated and amended on complaint.  Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties.  Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. States request on bail: $2000 cash bond. State gives prior criminal history. There are a couple of different F.T.A's within the State of Wisconsin and Minnesota along with felony bail jumping. This is the 3rd felony bail jumping and that is why State is asking for more money. Conditions of no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription; no operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. Defendant does have an open case in Carlton County and several bail jumping felonies. 
Atty Wyshnytzky requests high signature bond and indicates that defendant does have family with local ties to the community. Defendant did hire counsel privately. 
Court has several concerns regarding defendant's cases.  Court Orders $2000 cash bail with conditions of no operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license; no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Court offers dates for Preliminary hearing. Atty indicates the date being offered does not work. Atty waives time limits for purposes of scheduling.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
